package.name: default
package.desc: Default objects, do not edit this file

property.name: path
property.help: The path to generated files

property.name: embedded_files_path
property.help: The path to generated files for embedded files

property.name: file
property.help: The filenames for generated files

property.name: base_suffix
property.help: Identifier to append to base class defenition

property.name: prepend_project_name
property.help: Append project name to inherited class name

property.name: relative_path
property.help: Use relative paths for external files ( e.g. image files )

property.name: first_id
property.help: All GUI controls have an interger ID, this is the value for the first control, each additional control with increment by 1.

property.name: internationalize
property.help: For C++ Only. Generate strings with _() macro instead of wxT() macro. This allows for translation.

property.name: use_enum
property.help: For C++ Only. Generate an enumeration for control IDs instead of a list of #defines

property.name: use_array_enum
property.help: For C++ Only. Generate an enumeration for the dimensions of arrays

property.name: use_microsoft_bom
property.help: For C++ and WXMSW Only. Files are generated with UTF-8 encoding. Microsoft compiliers expect a specific byte sequence at the beginning of a file. GCC does NOT expect this. Only set this to true when using a Microsoft compiler.

property.name: precompiled_header
class_decoration
property.help: For C++ Only. Used to decorate classes with DLL export macros.

child.name: decoration
child.help: The name of the macro or the dll export decoration.

child.name: header
child.help: Optional header file where the export macro is defined.

property.name: namespace
property.help: For C++ Only. Namespaces to wrap class declarations in.

property.name: event_generation
property.help: For C++ Only. Type of event connection to generate.

property.name: disconnect_events
property.help: For event_generation=connect Only. Disconnect events in the destructor.

property.name: help_provider
property.help: For C++ Only. The class of help provider to use for context-sensitive help.

property.name: skip_lua_events
property.help: For Lua Only. Call Skip() function in all generated event handlers.

property.name: ui_table
property.help: For Lua Only. Define a table which will store- all UI stuff you'll create.

property.name: skip_python_events
property.help: For Python Only. Call Skip() function in all generated event handlers.

property.name: disconnect_python_events
property.help: For Python Only. Disconnect events in the destructor.

property.name: disconnect_mode
property.help: For Python Only. Choose which strategy will be used for disconnecting of events (due to different prototypes of Unbind() function in wxPython).

property.name: indent_with_spaces
property.help: For Python only. Use 4-spaces for indentation instead of tabs

property.name: image_path_wrapper_function_name
property.help: For Python only. Wrap image paths into a function with this name. Useful for freezing the application.

property.name: skip_php_events
property.help: For PHP Only. Call Skip() function in all generated event handlers.

property.name: disconnect_php_events
property.help: For PHP Only. Disconnect events in the destructor.

property.name: disconnect_mode
property.help: For PHP Only. Choose which strategy will be used for disconnecting of events (due to different prototypes of Unbind() function in wxPHP).

property.name: pos
property.help: Window position. The default is (-1, -1) which indicates that wxWidgets should generate a default position for the window.

property.name: size
property.help: Window size. The default is (-1, -1) which indicates that wxWidgets should generate a default size for the window.

property.name: minimum_size
property.help: Sets the minimum size of the window, to indicate to the sizer layout mechanism that this is the minimum required size.

property.name: maximum_size
property.help: Sets the maximum size of the window, to indicate to the sizer layout mechanism that this is the maximum allowable size.

property.name: font
property.help: Sets the font for this window. This should not be use for a parent window if you don't want its font to be inherited by its children

property.name: fg
property.help: Sets the foreground colour of the window.

property.name: bg
property.help: Sets the background colour of the window.

property.name: window_name
property.help: The name of the window. This parameter is used to associate a name with the item, allowing the application user to set Motif resource values for individual windows.

option.name: wxBORDER_DEFAULT
option.help: The window class will decide the kind of border to show, if any.

option.name: wxBORDER_SIMPLE
option.help: Displays a thin border around the window. wxSIMPLE_BORDER is the old name for this style.

option.name: wxBORDER_SUNKEN
option.help: Displays a sunken border. wxSUNKEN_BORDER is the old name for this style.

option.name: wxBORDER_RAISED
option.help: Displays a raised border. wxRAISED_BORDER is the old name for this style.

option.name: wxBORDER_STATIC
option.help: Displays a border suitable for a static control. wxSTATIC_BORDER is the old name for this style. Windows only.

option.name: wxBORDER_THEME
option.help: Displays a native border suitable for a control, on the current platform. On Windows XP or Vista, this will be a themed border; on most other platforms a sunken border will be used. For more information for themed borders on Windows, please see Themed borders on Windows.

option.name: wxBORDER_NONE
option.help: Displays no border, overriding the default border style for the window. wxNO_BORDER is the old name for this style.

option.name: wxTRANSPARENT_WINDOW
option.help: The window is transparent, that is, it will not receive paint events. Windows only.

option.name: wxTAB_TRAVERSAL
option.help: Use this to enable tab traversal for non-dialog windows.

option.name: wxWANTS_CHARS
option.help: Use this to indicate that the window wants to get all char/key events for all keys - even for keys like TAB or ENTER which are usually used for dialog navigation and which wouldn't be generated without this style. If you need to use this style in order to get the arrows or etc., but would still like to have normal keyboard navigation take place, you should call Navigate in response to the key events for Tab and Shift-Tab.

option.name: wxVSCROLL
option.help: Use this style to enable a vertical scrollbar. Notice that this style cannot be used with native controls which don't support scrollbars nor with top-level windows in most ports.

option.name: wxHSCROLL
option.help: Use this style to enable a horizontal scrollbar. The same limitations as for wxVSCROLL apply to this style.

option.name: wxALWAYS_SHOW_SB
option.help: If a window has scrollbars, disable them instead of hiding them when they are not needed (i.e. when the size of the window is big enough to not require the scrollbars to navigate it). This style is currently implemented for wxMSW, wxGTK and wxUniversal and does nothing on the other platforms.

option.name: wxCLIP_CHILDREN
option.help: Use this style to eliminate flicker caused by the background being repainted, then children being painted over them. Windows only.

option.name: wxFULL_REPAINT_ON_RESIZE
option.help: Use this style to force a complete redraw of the window whenever it is resized instead of redrawing just the part of the window affected by resizing. Note that this was the behaviour by default before 2.5.1 release and that if you experience redraw problems with code which previously used to work you may want to try this. Currently this style applies on GTK+ 2 and Windows only, and full repainting is always done on other platforms.

option.name: wxNO_FULL_REPAINT_ON_RESIZE
option.help: On Windows, this style used to disable repainting the window completely when its size is changed. Since this behaviour is now the default, the style is now obsolete and no longer has an effect.

option.name: wxWS_EX_VALIDATE_RECURSIVELY
option.help: By default, Validate/TransferDataTo/FromWindow() only work on direct children of the window (compatible behaviour). Set this flag to make them recursively descend into all subwindows.

option.name: wxWS_EX_BLOCK_EVENTS
option.help: wxCommandEvents and the objects of the derived classes are forwarded to the parent window and so on recursively by default. Using this flag for the given window allows to block this propagation at this window, i.e. prevent the events from being propagated further upwards. Dialogs have this flag on by default.

option.name: wxWS_EX_TRANSIENT
option.help: Don't use this window as an implicit parent for the other windows: this must be used with transient windows as otherwise there is the risk of creating a dialog/frame with this window as a parent which would lead to a crash if the parent is destroyed before the child.

option.name: wxWS_EX_CONTEXTHELP
option.help: Under Windows, puts a query button on the caption. When pressed, Windows will go into a context-sensitive help mode and wxWidgets will send a wxEVT_HELP event if the user clicked on an application window. This style cannot be used (because of the underlying native behaviour) together with wxMAXIMIZE_BOX or wxMINIMIZE_BOX, so these two styles are automatically turned off if this one is used.

option.name: wxWS_EX_PROCESS_IDLE
option.help: This window should always process idle events, even if the mode set by wxIdleEvent::SetMode is wxIDLE_PROCESS_SPECIFIED.

option.name: wxWS_EX_PROCESS_UI_UPDATES
option.help: This window should always process UI update events, even if the mode set by wxUpdateUIEvent::SetMode is wxUPDATE_UI_PROCESS_SPECIFIED.

property.name: tooltip
property.help: Attach a tooltip to the window.

property.name: context_menu
property.help: Generates event handler for displaying of menu assigned to this widgets as a context menu.

property.name: context_help
property.help: Attach context-sensitive help to the window. Note: The Project's "help_provider" property must be set for context-sensitive help to work.

property.name: enabled
property.help: Enable or disable the window for user input. Note that when a parent window is disabled, all of its children are disabled as well and they are reenabled again when the parent is.

property.name: hidden
property.help: Shows or hides the window.

property.name: subclass
property.help: For easy use of custom widgets which are simple variations from standard ones, without requiring a new plugin for wxFB or a full xrc handler for wxWidgets. For C++, this replaces the name of the class. For XRC, this sets the subclass value on the object tag.

child.name: header
child.help: For C++ Only. The header to be included for the subclass.

child.name: forward_declare
child.help: For C++ Only. Forward declare the subclass, otherwise include the header.

event.name: OnCharHook
event.help: Process a wxEVT_CHAR_HOOK event. Unlike all the other key events, this event is propagated upwards the window hierarchy which allows intercepting it in the parent window of the focused window to which it is sent initially (if there is no focused window, this event is sent to the wxApp global object). It is also generated before any other key events and so gives the parent window an opportunity to modify the keyboard handling of its children, e.g. it is used internally by wxWidgets in some ports to intercept pressing Esc key in any child of a dialog to close the dialog itself when it's pressed. By default, if this event is handled, i.e. the handler doesn't call wxEvent::Skip(), neither wxEVT_KEY_DOWN nor wxEVT_CHAR events will be generated (although wxEVT_KEY_UP still will be), i.e. it replaces the normal key events. However by calling the special DoAllowNextEvent() method you can handle wxEVT_CHAR_HOOK and still allow normal events generation. This is something that is rarely useful but can be required if you need to prevent a parent wxEVT_CHAR_HOOK handler from running without suppressing the normal key events. Finally notice that this event is not generated when the mouse is captured as it is considered that the window which has the capture should receive all the keyboard events too without allowing its parent wxTopLevelWindow to interfere with their processing.

event.name: OnKeyDown
event.help: Process a wxEVT_KEY_DOWN event (any key has been pressed). If this event is handled and not skipped, wxEVT_CHAR will not be generated at all for this key press (but wxEVT_KEY_UP will be).

event.name: OnKeyUp
event.help: Process a wxEVT_KEY_UP event (any key has been released).

event.name: OnMove
event.help: Process a wxEVT_MOVE event, which is generated when a window is moved. Not generated in wxGTK

event.name: OnTreeBeginDrag
event.help: Begin dragging with the left mouse button.

event.name: OnTreeBeginRDrag
event.help: Begin dragging with the right mouse button.

event.name: OnTreeEndDrag
event.help: End dragging with the left or right mouse button.

event.name: OnTreeBeginLabelEdit
event.help: Begin editing a label. This can be prevented by calling Veto().

event.name: OnTreeEndLabelEdit
event.help: Finish editing a label. This can be prevented by calling Veto().

event.name: OnTreeItemActivated
event.help: The item has been activated, i.e. chosen by double clicking it with mouse or from keyboard.

event.name: OnTreeItemCollapsing
event.help: The item is being collapsed. This can be prevented by calling Veto().

event.name: OnTreeItemExpanding
event.help: The item is being expanded. This can be prevented by calling Veto().

event.name: OnTreeItemRightClick
event.help: The user has clicked the item with the right mouse button

event.name: OnTreeItemMiddleClick
event.help: The user has clicked the item with the middle mouse button.

event.name: OnTreeSelChanging
event.help: Selection is changing. This can be prevented by calling Veto().

event.name: OnTreeItemMenu
event.help: The context menu for the selected item has been requested, either by a right click or by using the menu key.

property.name: markup
property.help: Simple markup can be used to apply different fonts or colours to different parts of the control label when supported. If markup is not supported by the control or platform, it is simply stripped and SetLabel() is used with the resulting string. Since 2.9.2.

property.name: bitmap
property.help: This is the bitmap shown in the default state, it must be always valid while all the other bitmaps are optional and don't have to be set.

property.name: disabled
property.help: Bitmap shown when the button is disabled.

property.name: pressed
property.help: Bitmap shown when the button is pushed (e.g. while the user keeps the mouse button pressed on it).

property.name: focus
property.help: Bitmap shown when the button has keyboard focus but is not pressed.

property.name: current
property.help: Bitmap shown when the mouse is over the button (but it is not pressed). Notice that if hover bitmap is not specified but the current platform UI uses hover images for the buttons (such as Windows XP or GTK+), then the focus bitmap is used for hover state as well. This makes it possible to set focus bitmap only to get reasonably good behaviour on all platforms.

option.name: wxLEFT
option.help: Positions the bitmap at the left

option.name: wxRIGHT
option.help: Positions the bitmap at the right

option.name: wxTOP
option.help: Positions the bitmap at the top

option.name: wxBOTTOM
option.help: Positions the bitmap at the bottom

property.name: margins
property.help: The margins between the bitmap and the text of the button. This is currently only implemented under MSW. If it is not specified, default margin is used around the bitmap.

property.name: aui_name
property.help: Sets the internal name of the pane.

property.name: caption_visible
property.help: Indicates that a pane caption should be visible.

property.name: caption
property.help: Sets the caption of the pane.

property.name: close_button
property.help: Indicates that a close button should be drawn for the pane.

property.name: maximize_button
property.help: Indicates that a maximize button should be drawn for the pane.

property.name: minimize_button
property.help: Indicates that a minimize button should be drawn for the pane.

property.name: pin_button
property.help: Indicates that a pin button should be drawn for the pane.

property.name: pane_border
property.help: Indicates that a border should be drawn for the pane.

property.name: show
property.help: Indicates that a pane should be shown.

property.name: gripper
property.help: Indicates that a gripper should be drawn for the pane.

property.name: center_pane
property.help: Specifies that the pane should adopt the default center pane settings. Centre panes usually do not have caption bars. This function provides an easy way of preparing a pane to be displayed in the center dock position.

property.name: default_pane
property.help: Specifies that the pane should adopt the default pane settings.

property.name: toolbar_pane
property.help: Specifies that the pane should adopt the default toolbar pane settings.

property.name: moveable
property.help: Indicates whether a frame can be moved.

property.name: pane_size
property.help: Sets the size of the floating pane.

property.name: best_size
property.help: Sets the ideal size for the pane.

property.name: min_size
property.help: Sets the minimum size of the pane.

property.name: max_size
property.help: Sets the maximum size of the pane.

property.name: dock_fixed
property.help: Causes the containing dock to have no resize sash. This is useful for creating panes that span the entire width or height of a dock, but should not be resizable in the other direction.

property.name: floatable
property.help: Sets whether the user will be able to undock a pane and turn it into a floating window.

property.name: BottomDockable
property.help: Indicates whether a pane can be docked at the bottom of the frame.

property.name: TopDockable
property.help: Indicates whether a pane can be docked at the top of the frame.

property.name: LeftDockable
property.help: Indicates whether a pane can be docked on the left of the frame.

property.name: RightDockable
property.help: Indicates whether a pane can be docked on the right of the frame.

property.name: docking
property.help: Determines the direction of the docked pane.

property.name: pane_position
property.help: Sets the position of the floating pane.

property.name: aui_position
property.help: Determines the position of the docked pane.

property.name: aui_row
property.help: Determines the row of the docked pane.

property.name: aui_layer
property.help: Determines the layer of the docked pane. The dock layer is similar to an onion, the inner-most layer being layer 0. Each shell moving in the outward direction has a higher layer number. This allows for more complex docking layout formation.

property.name: validator_type
property.help: For C++ Only. Type of a validator assigned to the window

property.name: validator_style
property.help: For C++ Only. Data filtering style for wxTextValidator.

property.name: validator_variable
property.help: For C++ Only. Name of a member variable associated with the validator

property.name: validator_data_type
property.help: For C++ Only. Data type of the member variable

option.help: Undefined data type.

option.name: bool
option.help: Logical value. This should be used for wxCheckBox and wxRadioButton.

option.name: int
option.help: Signed integer value. This should be used for wxGauge, wxScrollBar, wxRadioBox, wxSpinButton, wxChoice.

option.name: wxString
option.help: String value. This should be used for wxButton, wxComboBox, wxStaticText, wxTextCtrl.

option.name: wxArrayInt
option.help: Array of integers. This should be used for wxListBox, wxCheckListBox.
